page.title: 02HISTORIC BUILDINGS-BEDWORTH
page.content: {THE ALMSHOUSES}Built in 1841 they replaced the original buildings erected in the 17th century & founded by Nicholas Chamberlaine,Vicar of Bedworth from 1663 to 1715.The central building is in the form of a Tudor hall flanked by 23 renovated tenements These are inhabited by elderly residents.Other buildings adjoining the courtyard are the Pump House, Parsonage & Nurses House which are undergoing renovation.The buildings form part of the shopping centre.With their graceful Elizabethan-style chimneys & arcaded walkways they make an attractive centre piece. {HIGH VIEW HOSPITAL}in Hospital Lane was built in 1905 as a fever isolation hospital & was originally called Exhall Hospital.There are now 172 geriatric patients but it is due for closure in 1986.
